Filling: To taste – Salt, Pepper, Onion Powder, Garlic Powder

For the making the filling: Mash potatoes, onions, oil, eggs, and spices.
For the making the dough: Combine starch, eggs, water, and salt in a bowl.
Use 2-3 small pans to go a bit faster when cooking the dough
For each crepe: Wet a paper towel with oil to grease the pan before a new blintz is cooked
Stir the mixture of batter so the potato starch doesn’t sink to the bottom
Pour a small amount of batter into a lightly oiled frying pan on med-low heat.
Once golden brown, flop onto a cloth
For filling the crepe with filling: Drop about 1 Tbsp of filling on dough
Spray a cookie sheet with oil, place rolls side-by-side, spray top with oil
Freeze -> thaw -> bake for 15 minutes at 400˚F

additional_context.source: Adapted from Jewish Cooking in America book at the Farm
